intro: Decaspora laurina, commonly known as the golden star or starfruit plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe, with a distinctive star-shaped pattern on the surface. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Decaspora laurina is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
